summary: Prophet Adam (AS) was the first human being and prophet created by Allah. He was fashioned from clay and given life by Allah's breath. Adam was taught the names of all things, given superiority over angels in knowledge, and was placed in Paradise with his wife Hawwa (Eve). After being deceived by Iblis and eating from the forbidden tree, they were sent to Earth to establish humanity and worship Allah.
keyLessons: Knowledge is a divine gift that elevates humanity
Satan (Iblis) is mankind's eternal enemy
Sincere repentance leads to Allah's forgiveness
Pride and arrogance lead to destruction
Humans are vicegerents (Khalifah) on Earth
The importance of seeking forgiveness immediately after sin
Jealousy and envy can lead to terrible consequences (story of Qabil and Habil)

sections.title: The Creation of Adam
sections.content: Allah informed the angels of His decision to place a vicegerent (Khalifah) on Earth. The angels questioned this, wondering if this creation would cause corruption and bloodshed. Allah responded that He knows what they do not know. Adam was created from clay gathered from various parts of the earth, reflecting the diverse characteristics of his descendants. His body remained lifeless for forty years before Allah breathed life into him. When life entered Adam, the first thing he did was sneeze and say 'Alhamdulillah' (All praise is due to Allah).

verses.arabic: وَإِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي جَاعِلٞ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ خَلِيفَةٗۖ قَالُوٓاْ أَتَجۡعَلُ فِيهَا مَن يُفۡسِدُ فِيهَا وَيَسۡفِكُ ٱلدِّمَآءَ وَنَحۡنُ نُسَبِّحُ بِحَمۡدِكَ وَنُقَدِّسُ لَكَۖ قَالَ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa iz qaala rabbuka lil malaaa'ikati innee jaa'ilun fil ardi khaleefatan qaalooo ataj'alu feehaa mai yufsidu feehaa wa yasfikud dimaaa'a wa nahnu nusabbihu bihamdika wa nuqaddisu laka qaala inneee a'lamu maa laa ta'lamoon
verses.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority.' They said, 'Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?' Allah said, 'Indeed, I know that which you do not know.'

verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ
verses.transliteration: Khalaqal insaana min salsaalin kalfakhkhaar
verses.translation: He created man from sounding clay like the clay of pottery.

verses.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي خَٰلِقُۢ بَشَرٗا مِّن طِينٖ
verses.transliteration: Iz qaala rabbuka lil malaaa'ikati innee khaaliqum basharam min teen
verses.translation: When your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.'

hadiths.text: Angels were created from light, jinns were created from a smokeless flame of fire, and Adam was created from what has been described to you.
hadiths.textArabic: خلقت الملائكة من نور، وخلق الجن من مارج من نار، وخلق آدم مما وصف لك.

hadiths.text: Indeed Allah Most High created Adam from a handful that He took from all of the earth. So the children of Adam come in according with the earth, some of them come red, and white and black, and between that, and the thin, the thick, the filthy, and the clean.
hadiths.textArabic: إن الله تعالى خلق آدم من قبضته أخذها من الأرض كلها. فبني آدم يأتي بحسب الأرض، فمنهم من يأتي أحمر، وأبيض، وأسود، وبين ذلك والرقيق، والغليظ، والقذر، والنظيف.

hadiths.text: Allah created Adam, making him 60 cubits tall. And everyone who enters Paradise will be in the form of Adam. People have been decreasing in stature since Adam's creation.
hadiths.textArabic: خلق الله آدم فطوله 60 ذراعا. وكل من يدخل الجنة يكون على صورة آدم. لقد تناقصت قامت الناس منذ خلق آدم.

sections.contentArabic: وأخبر الله الملائكة قراره بجعل خليفة في الأرض. فتساءلت الملائكة عن ذلك، متسائلين عما إذا كان هذا الخلق يسبب الفساد وسفك الدماء. فأجاب الله أنه يعلم ما لا يعلمون. خُلق آدم من طين تم جمعه من مختلف أنحاء الأرض، مما يعكس الخصائص المتنوعة لنسله. وبقي جسده ميتا أربعين سنة قبل أن يحييه الله. عندما دخلت الحياة على آدم كان أول شيء فعله هو العطاس وقول الحمد لله.

sections.title: Adam Taught the Names of All Things
sections.content: Allah distinguished Adam by teaching him the names of all things - a knowledge not given to angels. This included the names of objects, their characteristics, and the ability to communicate with eloquence. Allah then presented Adam before the angels and asked them to name these things, but they could not. When Adam recited the names to the angels, it demonstrated the superiority of human knowledge and wisdom. This established humanity's role as teachers and bearers of knowledge on Earth.

verses.arabic: وَعَلَّمَ ءَادَمَ ٱلۡأَسۡمَآءَ كُلَّهَا ثُمَّ عَرَضَهُمۡ عَلَى ٱلۡمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ فَقَالَ أَنۢبِـُٔونِي بِأَسۡمَآءِ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa 'allama Aaadamal asmaaa'a kullahaa summa 'aradahum 'alal malaaa'ikati faqaala ambi'oonee bi asmaaa'i haaa'ulaaa'i in kuntum saadiqeen
verses.translation: And He taught Adam the names - all of them. Then He showed them to the angels and said, 'Tell Me the names of these, if what you say is true?'

verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ أَنۢبِئۡهُم بِأَسۡمَآئِهِمۡۖ فَلَمَّآ أَنۢبَأَهُم بِأَسۡمَآئِهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ غَيۡبَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَأَعۡلَمُ مَا تُبۡدُونَ وَمَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡتُمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaala yaa Aadamu ambi' hum bi-asmaaa'ihim falamma amba ahum bi-asmaaa'ihim qaala alam aqul lakum innee a'lamu ghaibas samaawaati wal ard wa a'lamu maa tubdoona wa maa kuntum taktumoon
verses.translation: He said, 'O Adam! Inform them of their names.' And when he had informed them of their names, He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?'

sections.contentArabic: وقد ميز الله آدم بأن علمه أسماء الأشياء كلها، وهو علم لم يعط للملائكة. وشمل ذلك أسماء الأشياء وخصائصها والقدرة على التواصل بالبلاغة. ثم عرض الله آدم على الملائكة وطلب منهم تسمية هذه الأشياء فلم يستطيعوا. وعندما تلا آدم الأسماء على الملائكة، دل ذلك على تفوق المعرفة البشرية والحكمة. أدى هذا إلى ترسيخ دور البشرية كمعلمين وحاملين للمعرفة على الأرض.

sections.title: Iblis Refuses to Prostrate
sections.content: After breathing life into Adam, Allah commanded all angels to prostrate to Adam as a sign of respect. All angels obeyed except Iblis (Satan), who was a jinn and had free will. Iblis refused out of pride and arrogance, claiming he was superior to Adam because he was created from fire while Adam was created from clay. This act of disobedience led to Iblis being expelled from Paradise and cursed. However, Iblis requested respite until the Day of Judgment, vowing to mislead humanity from the straight path. This established the eternal enmity between Satan and mankind.

verses.arabic: فَسَجَدَ ٱلۡمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Fasajadal malaaa'ikatu kulluhum ajma'oon
verses.translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.

verses.arabic: إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Illaaa Iblees; abaa ai yakoona ma'as saajideen
verses.translation: Except Iblis; he refused to be with those who prostrated.

verses.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَلَّا تَسۡجُدَ إِذۡ أَمَرۡتُكَۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡهُ خَلَقۡتَنِي مِن نَّارٖ وَخَلَقۡتَهُۥ مِن طِينٖ
verses.transliteration: Qaala maa mana'aka allaa tasjuda iz amartuk; qaala ana khairum minh; khalaqtanee min naarinw wa khalaqtahoo min teen
verses.translation: Allah said, 'What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?' Satan said, 'I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay.'

verses.arabic: وَإِذۡ قُلۡنَا لِلۡمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسۡجُدُواْ لِأٓدَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓاْ إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ
verses.transliteration: Wa iz qulnaa lil malaaa'ikatsi-judoo li Aadama fasajadooo illaaa Iblees; kaana minal jinni fafasaqa 'an amri Rabbih
verses.translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord.

sections.contentArabic: بعد أن نفخ الله الحياة في آدم، أمر الله جميع الملائكة بالسجود لآدم احتراما له. أطاعت الملائكة كلهم ​​إلا إبليس (الشيطان) الذي كان من الجن وله إرادة حرة. فرفض إبليس كبرياء وكبرياء، مدعيا أنه أفضل من آدم لأنه خلق من نار وآدم خلق من طين. أدى هذا العصيان إلى طرد إبليس من الجنة ولعنه. ومع ذلك، طلب إبليس مهلة حتى يوم القيامة، متعهدا بإضلال البشرية عن الصراط المستقيم. أدى هذا إلى ظهور العداوة الأبدية بين الشيطان والبشر.

sections.title: Life in Paradise and the Forbidden Tree
sections.content: Adam and Hawwa (Eve) lived in Paradise with complete freedom to enjoy all its blessings. However, Allah prohibited them from approaching one specific tree. This single prohibition served as a test of their obedience and free will. Iblis, seeking to prove humans were weak, whispered to them daily, suggesting that the tree would grant them immortality and eternal kingdom. He swore to be their sincere advisor and convinced them that Allah only forbade the tree to prevent them from becoming angels. Eventually, they succumbed to the temptation and ate from the forbidden tree, immediately becoming aware of their nakedness and filled with shame.

verses.arabic: وَقُلۡنَا يَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ ٱسۡكُنۡ أَنتَ وَزَوۡجُكَ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ وَكُلَا مِنۡهَا رَغَدًا حَيۡثُ شِئۡتُمَا وَلَا تَقۡرَبَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qulnaa yaa Aadamus kun anta wa zawjukal jannata wa kulaa minhaa raghadan haisu shi'tumaa wa laa taqrabaa haazihish shajarata fatakoonaa minaz zaalimeen
verses.translation: And We said, 'O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers.'

verses.arabic: فَوَسۡوَسَ لَهُمَا ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ لِيُبۡدِيَ لَهُمَا مَا وُۥرِيَ عَنۡهُمَا مِن سَوۡءَٰتِهِمَا وَقَالَ مَا نَهَىٰكُمَا رَبُّكُمَا عَنۡ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَا مَلَكَيۡنِ أَوۡ تَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلۡخَـٰلِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fawaswasa lahumash Shaitaanu liyubdiya lahumaa maa wooriya 'anhumaa min saw aatihimaa wa qaala maa nahaakumaa Rabbukumaa 'an haazihish shajarati illaaa an takoonaa malakaini aw takoonaa minal khaalideen
verses.translation: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, 'Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal.'

verses.arabic: فَدَلَّىٰهُمَا بِغُرُورٖۚ فَلَمَّا ذَاقَا ٱلشَّجَرَةَ بَدَتۡ لَهُمَا سَوۡءَٰتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخۡصِفَانِ عَلَيۡهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ ٱلۡجَنَّةِۖ وَنَادَىٰهُمَا رَبُّهُمَآ أَلَمۡ أَنۡهَكُمَا عَن تِلۡكُمَا ٱلشَّجَرَةِ وَأَقُل لَّكُمَآ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَ لَكُمَا عَدُوّٞ مُّبِينٞ
verses.transliteration: Fadallaahumaa bighuroor; falammaa zaaqash shajarata badat lahumaa saw aatu humaa wa tafiqaa yakhsifaani 'alaihimaa minw waraqil jannah; wa naadaahumaa Rabbuhumaaa alam anhakumaa 'an tilkumash shajarati wa aqul lakumaaa innash Shaitaana lakumaa 'aduwwum mubeen
verses.translation: So he made them fall, through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, 'Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?'

sections.contentArabic: لقد عاش آدم وحواء في الجنة بكامل الحرية في التمتع بكل بركاتها. إلا أن الله نهاهم عن الاقتراب من شجرة معينة. كان هذا الحظر الوحيد بمثابة اختبار لطاعتهم وإرادتهم الحرة. كان إبليس يسعى لإثبات ضعف البشر، وكان يهمس لهم يوميًا، مشيرًا إلى أن الشجرة ستمنحهم الخلود والملكوت الأبدي. وأقسم أن يكون ناصحهم الصادق وأقنعهم بأن الله لم يحرم الشجرة إلا ليمنعهم من أن يصبحوا ملائكة. في النهاية، استسلموا للإغراء وأكلوا من الشجرة المحرمة، وسرعان ما أدركوا عريتهم وامتلأوا بالخجل.

sections.title: Repentance and Descent to Earth
sections.content: After realizing their mistake, Adam and Hawwa were filled with remorse and immediately turned to Allah seeking forgiveness. They acknowledged their wrongdoing and pleaded for Allah's mercy. Allah accepted their sincere repentance but decreed that they, along with Iblis, would be sent down to Earth. Allah declared that humans and Iblis would be enemies on Earth, and that Earth would be their dwelling place and provision for an appointed time. This descent marked the beginning of human life on Earth and the test of faith.

verses.arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمۡنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمۡ تَغۡفِرۡ لَنَا وَتَرۡحَمۡنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡخَـٰسِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaalaa Rabbanaa zalamnaaa anfusanaa wa il lam taghfir lanaa wa tarhamnaa lanakoonanna minal khaasireen
verses.translation: They said, 'Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.'

verses.arabic: قَالَ ٱهۡبِطُواْ بَعۡضُكُمۡ لِبَعۡضٍ عَدُوّٞۖ وَلَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُسۡتَقَرّٞ وَمَتَٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٖ
verses.transliteration: Qaalah bitoo ba'dukum liba'din 'aduww; wa lakum fil ardi mustaqarrunw wa mataa'un ilaa heen
verses.translation: Allah said, 'Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time.'

verses.arabic: فَتَلَقَّىٰٓ ءَادَمُ مِن رَّبِّهِۦ كَلِمَٰتٖ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡهِۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Fatalaqqaaa Aadamu mir Rabbihee Kalimaatin fataaba 'alayh; innahoo Huwat Tawwaabur Raheem
verses.translation: Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

sections.contentArabic: وبعد أن أدركا خطأهما، امتلأ آدم وحواء بالندم وتوجها على الفور إلى الله مستغفرين. واعترفوا بخطئهم وطلبوا رحمة الله. قبل الله توبتهم الصادقة، لكنه قضى لهم أن ينزلوا مع إبليس إلى الأرض. وأخبر الله أن البشر وإبليس عدوان في الأرض، وأن الأرض ستكون مسكنهم ومتاعهم إلى أجل مسمى. كان هذا النزول بمثابة بداية حياة الإنسان على الأرض واختبار الإيمان.

sections.title: The First Murder: Qabil and Habil
sections.content: Adam and Hawwa were blessed with children on Earth. Their first two sets of twins were Qabil (Cain) with his sister, and Habil (Abel) with his sister. Allah commanded Adam to marry each son to the other's twin sister to populate the earth. While Habil accepted this command with obedience, Qabil refused out of selfishness, as he found his own twin sister more beautiful. To resolve the dispute, Allah commanded each son to offer a sacrifice. Habil offered his best lamb with sincerity, while Qabil offered his worst harvest. Allah accepted Habil's sacrifice but rejected Qabil's. Consumed by jealousy and rage, Qabil murdered his brother Habil, making this the first death and murder in human history. Afterward, not knowing what to do with the body, Qabil witnessed a crow burying another dead crow, which taught him how to bury his brother.

verses.arabic: وَٱتۡلُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَبَأَ ٱبۡنَيۡ ءَادَمَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ إِذۡ قَرَّبَا قُرۡبَانٗا فَتُقُبِّلَ مِنۡ أَحَدِهِمَا وَلَمۡ يُتَقَبَّلۡ مِنَ ٱلۡأٓخَرِ قَالَ لَأَقۡتُلَنَّكَۖ قَالَ إِنَّمَا يَتَقَبَّلُ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Watlu 'alaihim naba abnai Aadama bilhaqq; iz qarrabaa qurbaanan fatuqubbila min ahadihimaa wa lam yutaqabbal minal aakhari qaala la-aqtulannaka qaala innamaa yataqabbalul laahu minal muttaqeen
verses.translation: And recite to them the story of Adam's two sons, in truth, when they both offered a sacrifice [to Allah], and it was accepted from one of them but was not accepted from the other. Said [the latter], 'I will surely kill you.' Said [the former], 'Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous [who fear Him].'

verses.arabic: فَبَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ غُرَابٗا يَبۡحَثُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيُرِيَهُۥ كَيۡفَ يُوَٰرِي سَوۡءَةَ أَخِيهِۚ قَالَ يَٰوَيۡلَتَىٰٓ أَعَجَزۡتُ أَنۡ أَكُونَ مِثۡلَ هَٰذَا ٱلۡغُرَابِ فَأُوَٰرِيَ سَوۡءَةَ أَخِيۖ فَأَصۡبَحَ مِنَ ٱلنَّـٰدِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Faba'asal laahu ghuraabañy yabhathu fil ardi liyuriyahoo kaifa yuwaaree saw ata akheehi qaala yaa wailataa a'ajaztu an akoona misla haazal ghuraabi fa-uwaariya saw ata akheee fa-asbaha minan naadimeen
verses.translation: Then Allah sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, 'O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the body of my brother?' And he became of the regretful.

sections.contentArabic: ورزق آدم وحواء بأبناء على الأرض. وكان أول توأم لهما هما قابيل (قابيل) مع أخته، وهابيل (هابيل) مع أخته. أمر الله آدم أن يزوج كل ابن من أخت الآخر التوأم ليعمروا الأرض. وبينما قبل هابيل هذا الأمر بطاعة، رفض قابيل أنانيته، إذ وجد أخته التوأم أجمل منه. ولحل الخلاف أمر الله كل ابن أن يقدم أضحية. وقدم هابيل أفضل حمل عنده بإخلاص، وقدم قابيل أسوأ حصاده. فقبل ​​الله قربان هابيل ورفض قربان قابيل. قتل قابيل أخاه هابيل بسبب الغيرة والغضب، مما جعل هذه أول جريمة قتل وقتل في تاريخ البشرية. وبعد ذلك، لم يعرف قابيل ماذا يفعل بالجثة، فشاهد غرابًا يدفن غرابًا ميتًا آخر، فعلمه قابيل كيفية دفن أخيه.

sections.title: The Death of Prophet Adam
sections.content: When Adam fell gravely ill, he expressed a desire to taste the fruits of Paradise. His children set out to fulfill his wish but encountered angels carrying Adam's shroud and burial materials. The angels instructed them to return home as their father was approaching his end. The angels took Adam's soul, prepared his body for burial, wrapped him in the shroud, dug his grave, and laid him to rest. They then taught Adam's children the proper funeral rites, establishing this as the tradition for humanity at the time of death. Following Adam's death, his son Seth (Sheeth) succeeded him as a prophet and guide for the people.
sections.contentArabic: عندما مرض آدم بشدة، أعرب عن رغبته في تذوق ثمار الجنة. انطلق أطفاله لتحقيق رغبته ولكنهم واجهوا ملائكة يحملون كفن آدم ومواد دفنه. أمرهم الملائكة بالعودة إلى المنزل حيث كان والدهم يقترب من نهايته. أخذت الملائكة روح آدم، وأعدوا جسده للدفن، وكفنوه، وحفروا قبره، ووضعوه في مكانه. ثم قاموا بتعليم أبناء آدم طقوس الجنازة المناسبة، وجعلوا ذلك تقليدًا للبشرية وقت الموت. وبعد وفاة آدم، خلفه ابنه شيث (شيث) كنبي ومرشد للناس.

historicalNotes: Prophet Adam is believed to have lived for 930-960 years according to various narrations. The location of his grave is disputed, with some traditions suggesting Mecca and others suggesting India or Jerusalem. His legacy as the father of humanity and the first prophet establishes the foundation of Islamic belief in prophethood and human responsibility on Earth.
summaryArabic: النبي آدم (ع) هو أول إنسان ونبي خلقه الله. خلق من الطين وأحيا بنفخة الله. وعلم آدم الأسماء كلها، وفضل على الملائكة في العلم، وأدخل الجنة مع زوجته حواء. بعد أن خدعهم إبليس وأكلوا من الشجرة المحرمة، تم إرسالهم إلى الأرض لتأسيس الإنسانية وعبادة الله.
historicalNotesArabic: يُعتقد أن النبي آدم عاش ما بين 930 إلى 960 عامًا وفقًا لروايات مختلفة. موقع قبره محل خلاف، حيث تشير بعض التقاليد إلى مكة والبعض الآخر يشير إلى الهند أو القدس. إن إرثه كأب البشرية والنبي الأول يؤسس أساس العقيدة الإسلامية في النبوة ومسؤولية الإنسان على الأرض.
keyLessonsArabic: المعرفة هبة إلهية تسمو بالإنسانية
الشيطان (إبليس) هو العدو الأبدي للبشرية
والتوبة الصادقة تؤدي إلى مغفرة الله
الكبرياء والغطرسة يؤديان إلى الدمار
البشر خلفاء في الأرض
أهمية الاستغفار مباشرة بعد الذنب
الغيرة والحسد قد يؤديان إلى عواقب وخيمة (قصة قابيل وهابيل)

summary: Prophet Idris (AS), known as Enoch in the Bible, was either the second or third prophet in Islamic tradition. He was the forefather of Prophet Nuh and was known for his profound knowledge, truthfulness, and patience. Idris was the first to write with a pen and had extensive knowledge of astronomy and mathematics. He was raised to a lofty station by Allah and called his people to jihad against corruption, becoming the first prophet to fight against evil.
keyLessons: Knowledge and wisdom are gifts from Allah to be used for good
Fighting against corruption is a divine obligation
Patience and truthfulness are qualities of the righteous
Innovation in learning and knowledge is encouraged in Islam
Standing up against evil may require courage and action

sections.title: The Qualities of Prophet Idris
sections.content: Prophet Idris was described as a well-built man with a strong, broad chest who spoke with a low voice. He was tall, handsome, and always showed calmness in his demeanor. Beyond his physical attributes, he was intellectually curious and pondered the vastness of the universe - from the sky, the earth, the moon, the stars, and the clouds. The Qur'an describes him as a man of truth (Siddiq) and a prophet who was raised to a lofty station. Idris was recognized as the first person to learn how to write with a pen, and he had extensive knowledge of astrology and mathematics.

verses.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرۡ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ إِدۡرِيسَۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقٗا نَّبِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi Idrees; innahoo kaana siddeeqan Nabiyyaa
verses.translation: And mention in the Book, Idris. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

verses.arabic: وَرَفَعۡنَٰهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa rafa'naahu makaanan 'aliyyaa
verses.translation: And We raised him to a high station.

verses.arabic: وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَإِدۡرِيسَ وَذَا ٱلۡكِفۡلِۖ كُلّٞ مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Ismaa'eela wa Idreesa wa Zal Kifli kullum minas saabireen
verses.translation: And [mention] Ishmael and Idris and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

sections.contentArabic: وقد وُصِف النبي إدريس بأنه رجل قوي البنية، قوي البنية، عريض الصدر، يتكلم بصوت منخفض. كان طويل القامة ووسيمًا ويظهر دائمًا الهدوء في سلوكه. وبعيدًا عن صفاته الجسدية، كان فضوليًا فكريًا ويتأمل في اتساع الكون - من السماء والأرض والقمر والنجوم والسحب. يصفه القرآن بأنه رجل صدق (صديق) ونبي رفع إلى مكانة عالية. ويُعرف إدريس بأنه أول من تعلم الكتابة بالقلم، وكان لديه معرفة واسعة بعلم التنجيم والرياضيات.

sections.title: Birth and Prophethood
sections.content: Idris was born during the lifetime of Prophet Adam and is believed to have been among the followers of Sheeth (Seth), Adam's son who succeeded him. After the death of Sheeth, Idris ruled over the progeny of Adam. He was a sincere servant of Allah, and for this, Allah chose him as a prophet and messenger and elected him as ruler over the children of Adam. During this time, the people of Qabil (Cain) had lost guidance, and sin and corruption began spreading rapidly. Idris could not bear to watch his people falling prey to the influence of Satan.
sections.contentArabic: ولد إدريس في عهد النبي آدم ويعتقد أنه كان من أتباع شيث (شيث) ابن آدم الذي خلفه. وبعد وفاة شيث ملك إدريس على ذرية آدم. لقد كان عبداً صادقاً لله، ولهذا اختاره الله نبياً ورسولاً، وانتخبه حاكماً على بني آدم. وفي هذا الوقت فقد قوم قابيل (قابيل) الهداية، وبدأت الخطيئة والفساد ينتشران بسرعة. لم يتحمل إدريس أن يرى قومه يقعون فريسة لتأثير الشيطان.

sections.title: The First Jihad Against Corruption
sections.content: Allah instructed Prophet Idris to call for jihad (holy struggle) against the corrupt followers of Qabil. This made Idris the first prophet and messenger in Islamic history to perform jihad against corruption and evil. As commanded by Allah, Idris gathered an army of righteous men and battled in the name of Allah against the transgressors. Through Allah's support, they emerged victorious, establishing justice and the worship of Allah alone. This demonstrates that sometimes peaceful dawah (invitation to Islam) must be supplemented with active struggle against oppression.
sections.contentArabic: أمر الله النبي إدريس بالدعوة إلى الجهاد ضد أتباع قابيل الفاسدين. مما جعل إدريس أول نبي ورسول في التاريخ الإسلامي يجاهد ضد الفساد والشر. بأمر الله، جمع إدريس جيشا من الصالحين وقاتل في سبيل الله ضد المعتدين. وبتوفيق الله خرجوا منتصرين، وأقاموا العدل وعبادة الله وحده. وهذا يوضح أن الدعوة السلمية في بعض الأحيان (الدعوة إلى الإسلام) يجب أن تُستكمل بالنضال النشط ضد الظلم.

historicalNotes: The details of Prophet Idris's life come from older scriptures that have undergone changes over time. While Muslims can learn from his story, we must ensure the lessons do not contradict the Qur'an and Sunnah. Some scholars identify him as Enoch from the Bible. The exact nature of his 'raising to a lofty station' is subject to various interpretations - some believe he was raised to the heavens alive, while others interpret it as a spiritual elevation.
summaryArabic: النبي إدريس (ع)، المعروف باسم أخنوخ في الكتاب المقدس، كان إما النبي الثاني أو الثالث في التقليد الإسلامي. وهو جد النبي نوح، وكان معروفًا بعلمه العميق وصدقه وصبره. كان إدريس أول من خط بالقلم، وكان واسع المعرفة بعلم الفلك والرياضيات. وقد رفعه الله مقامًا ساميًا ودعا قومه إلى الجهاد ضد الفساد، ليصبح أول نبي يحارب الشر.
historicalNotesArabic: تفاصيل حياة النبي إدريس تأتي من الكتب المقدسة القديمة التي خضعت لتغييرات مع مرور الوقت. وبينما يمكن للمسلمين أن يتعلموا من قصته، يجب علينا التأكد من أن الدروس لا تتعارض مع القرآن والسنة. يعرفه بعض العلماء على أنه أخنوخ من الكتاب المقدس. إن الطبيعة الدقيقة لـ "رفعه إلى المقام الرفيع" تخضع لتفسيرات مختلفة - يعتقد البعض أنه رُفع إلى السماء حيًا، بينما يفسره آخرون على أنه ارتفاع روحي.
keyLessonsArabic: العلم والحكمة هدية من الله يستخدمها في الخير
محاربة الفساد واجب إلهي
الصبر والصدق من صفات الصالحين
الابتكار في التعلم والمعرفة يشجع في الإسلام
إن الوقوف ضد الشر قد يتطلب الشجاعة والعمل

summary: Prophet Nuh (AS), known as Noah in Biblical tradition, was sent to his people who had fallen into idol worship. He preached for 950 years, calling them to worship Allah alone. When they persistently rejected his message, Allah commanded him to build an ark. The Great Flood destroyed the disbelievers while Nuh and the believers were saved, making him the second father of humanity after Adam.
keyLessons: Patience and perseverance in calling to Allah
Trust in Allah's promise even when facing mockery
Faith supersedes family ties when it comes to truth
Allah's punishment comes after prolonged warning
Gratitude to Allah for salvation
The importance of following divine commands precisely

sections.title: The Mission of Prophet Nuh
sections.content: Prophet Nuh was sent to his people who had abandoned the pure monotheism of their forefathers and begun worshipping idols. These idols - Wadd, Suwa, Yaghuth, Ya'uq, and Nasr - were originally names of righteous men whose images were later venerated after their deaths. Nuh called his people day and night, publicly and privately, for 950 years, but most of them remained stubbornly upon disbelief. The elite among them rejected his message, calling him merely a human like themselves and noting that only the poor and weak followed him.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِيهِمۡ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٍ إِلَّا خَمۡسِينَ عَامٗا فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلطُّوفَانُ وَهُمۡ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Noohan ilaa qawmihee falabisa feehim alfa sanatin illaa khamseena 'aaman fa akhazahumut toofaanu wa hum zaalimoon
verses.translation: And We certainly sent Nuh to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi innee da'awtu qawmee laylanw wa naahaaraa
verses.translation: He said, 'My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.'

sections.contentArabic: أرسل النبي نوح إلى قومه الذين تركوا التوحيد الخالص الذي كان عليه آباؤهم وبدؤوا بعبادة الأصنام. وهذه الأصنام - ود، وسوا، ويغوث، ويعوق، ونصر - كانت في الأصل أسماء لرجال صالحين عُظِّمت صورهم فيما بعد بعد وفاتهم. دعا نوح قومه ليلا ونهارا سرا ونهارا لمدة 950 سنة، فأستمر أكثرهم على الكفر. وقد رفض النخبة منهم رسالته، ووصفوه بأنه مجرد إنسان مثلهم، مشيرين إلى أنه لا يتبعه إلا الفقراء والضعفاء.

sections.title: The People's Rejection
sections.content: Despite Nuh's tireless efforts, his people rejected his message with increasing hostility. They covered their ears, wrapped themselves in their garments, and persisted in arrogance. The leaders among them argued that Nuh was just a man like themselves and that his followers were merely the lowest members of society. They demanded he drive away the poor believers if he wanted the elite to listen. Nuh refused, recognizing that faith is not measured by worldly status. The people grew so hostile that they threatened to stone him if he did not stop preaching.

verses.arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
verses.transliteration: Wa inni kullamaa da'awtuhum litaghfira lahum ja'alooo asaabi'ahum feee aazaanihim wastagshaw siyaabahum wa asarroo wastakbarust ikbaaraa
verses.translation: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.

verses.arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa Noohu latakoonanna minal marjoomeen
verses.translation: They said, 'If you do not desist, O Nuh, you will surely be of those who are stoned.'

sections.contentArabic: وعلى الرغم من جهود نوح الحثيثة، إلا أن قومه رفضوا رسالته بعداء متزايد. فغطوا آذانهم، ولفوا ثيابهم، واستمروا في الاستكبار. وزعم الزعماء منهم أن نوحًا كان مجرد رجل مثلهم، وأن أتباعه كانوا مجرد أدنى أفراد المجتمع. وطالبوا بطرد فقراء المؤمنين إذا أراد أن تستمع النخبة. رفض نوح، مدركًا أن الإيمان لا يقاس بالمكانة الدنيوية. أصبح الناس عدائيين لدرجة أنهم هددوا برجمه إذا لم يتوقف عن الكرازة.

sections.title: Nuh's Prayer Against His People
sections.content: After centuries of preaching with no positive response, and after Allah revealed that no more of his people would believe, Nuh finally prayed against them. This was not from anger or impatience, but because Allah informed him that continuing to call them was futile. Nuh asked Allah not to leave a single disbeliever on earth, knowing that they would only lead future generations astray. This prayer was answered through the Great Flood.

verses.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
verses.transliteration: Wa qaala Noohur Rabbi laa tazar 'alal ardi minal kaafireena dayyaaraa
verses.translation: And Nuh said, 'My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.'

verses.arabic: وَأُوحِيَ إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ أَنَّهُۥ لَن يُؤۡمِنَ مِن قَوۡمِكَ إِلَّا مَن قَدۡ ءَامَنَ فَلَا تَبۡتَئِسۡ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa oohiya ilaa Noohin annahoo lai yu'mina min qawmika illaa man qad aamana falaa tabta'is bimaa kaanoo yaf'aloon
verses.translation: And it was revealed to Nuh that, 'No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.'

sections.contentArabic: بعد قرون من الوعظ دون استجابة إيجابية، وبعد أن كشف الله أنه لن يؤمن المزيد من قومه، دعا نوح أخيرًا ضدهم. ولم يكن ذلك عن غضب أو نفاذ صبر، بل لأن الله أخبره أن الاستمرار في دعوتهم لا جدوى منه. لقد طلب نوح من الله ألا يترك على الأرض كافراً واحداً، لعلمه أنهم لن يؤديوا إلا إلى ضلال الأجيال القادمة. وقد استجابت هذه الصلاة من خلال الطوفان العظيم.

sections.title: Building the Ark
sections.content: Allah commanded Nuh to build a massive ship, an unprecedented task in a land far from any sea. Under divine guidance, Nuh began constructing the ark. His people mocked him relentlessly, asking why he was building a ship in the desert. Each time they passed by and ridiculed him, Nuh responded that just as they mocked him now, the believers would eventually mock them. He continued his work with patience and determination, knowing that Allah's promise would be fulfilled.

verses.arabic: وَٱصۡنَعِ ٱلۡفُلۡكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَا وَوَحۡيِنَا وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبۡنِي فِي ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ إِنَّهُم مُّغۡرَقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wasna'il fulka bi a'yuninaa wa wahyinaa wa laa tukhaatibnee fil lazeena zalamoo innahum mughraqoon
verses.translation: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.

verses.arabic: وَيَصۡنَعُ ٱلۡفُلۡكَ وَكُلَّمَا مَرَّ عَلَيۡهِ مَلَأٞ مِّن قَوۡمِهِۦ سَخِرُواْ مِنۡهُۚ قَالَ إِن تَسۡخَرُواْ مِنَّا فَإِنَّا نَسۡخَرُ مِنكُمۡ كَمَا تَسۡخَرُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa yasna'ul fulka wa kullamaa marra 'alaihi mala'um min qawmihee sakhiroo minh; qaala in taskharoo minnaa fa innaa naskharu minkum kamaa taskharoon
verses.translation: And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, 'If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.'

sections.contentArabic: أمر الله نوحًا أن يبني سفينة ضخمة، وهي مهمة لم يسبق لها مثيل في أرض بعيدة عن أي بحر. وبتوجيه إلهي، بدأ نوح في بناء السفينة. سخر منه شعبه بلا هوادة، وسألوه لماذا كان يبني سفينة في الصحراء. وفي كل مرة مروا به وسخروا منه، أجاب نوح أنه كما يسخرون منه الآن، فإن المؤمنين سيسخرون منهم في النهاية. وواصل عمله بصبر وإصرار، وهو يعلم أن وعد الله سيتحقق.

sections.title: The Great Flood
sections.content: When the command came, water gushed forth from the earth and poured from the sky in unprecedented amounts. Nuh loaded the ark with pairs of every species and the believers - a small group compared to the masses who rejected him. The waves rose like mountains, engulfing the earth. Even in these final moments, Nuh called out to his son who had chosen to remain with the disbelievers, but the son arrogantly believed he could survive on a mountain. A wave came between them, and he was among the drowned.

verses.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَمۡرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ قُلۡنَا ٱحۡمِلۡ فِيهَا مِن كُلّٖ زَوۡجَيۡنِ ٱثۡنَيۡنِ وَأَهۡلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ وَمَنۡ ءَامَنَۚ وَمَآ ءَامَنَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلٞ
verses.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'a amrunaa wa faarat tannooru qulnah mil feehaa min kullin zawjaynis naini wa ahlaka illaa man sabaqa 'alaihil qawlu wa man aaman; wa maaa aamana ma'ahooo illaa qaleel
verses.translation: Until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, 'Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed.' But none had believed with him, except a few.

verses.arabic: قَالَ سَـَٔاوِىٓ إِلَىٰ جَبَلٖ يَعۡصِمُنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمَآءِۚ قَالَ لَا عَاصِمَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ مِنۡ أَمۡرِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَۚ وَحَالَ بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلۡمَوۡجُ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُغۡرَقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaala sa aaweee ilaa jabaliny ya'simunee minal maaa'; qaala laa 'aasimal yawma min amril laahi illaa mar rahim; wa haala bainahumal mawju fakaana minal mughraqeen
verses.translation: [His son] said, 'I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water.' [Nuh] said, 'There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy.' And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.

sections.contentArabic: فلما جاء الأمر، انفجر الماء من الأرض، وانهمر من السماء مقادير غير مسبوقة. لقد حمل نوح السفينة بأزواج من كل الأصناف والمؤمنين، وهم فئة قليلة مقارنة بالجماهير التي رفضته. ارتفعت الأمواج مثل الجبال، وغطت الأرض. حتى في هذه اللحظات الأخيرة، نادى نوح ابنه الذي اختار البقاء مع الكفار، لكن الابن اعتقد بغطرسة أنه يستطيع البقاء على قيد الحياة على الجبل. فحال بينهما موج فكان من الغرقى.

sections.title: Safe Landing and New Beginning
sections.content: After the floodwaters subsided, the ark came to rest on Mount Judi. Allah commanded the earth to swallow its water and the sky to clear. Nuh and the believers disembarked to begin humanity anew on a purified earth. Allah blessed Nuh and those with him, promising that from their descendants would come nations. This marked a fresh start for humanity, with Nuh being considered the second father of mankind after Adam.

verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ يَـٰٓأَرۡضُ ٱبۡلَعِي مَآءَكِ وَيَٰسَمَآءُ أَقۡلِعِي وَغِيضَ ٱلۡمَآءُ وَقُضِيَ ٱلۡأَمۡرُ وَٱسۡتَوَتۡ عَلَى ٱلۡجُودِيِّ وَقِيلَ بُعۡدٗا لِّلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa qeela yaaa ardu abla'ee maaa'aki wa yaa samaaa'u aqli'ee wa gheedral maaa'u wa qudiyal amru wastawat 'alal joodiyyi wa qeela bu'dal lilqawmiz zaalimeen
verses.translation: And it was said, 'O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain].' And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on [Mount] Judi. And it was said, 'Away with the wrongdoing people.'

verses.arabic: قِيلَ يَٰنُوحُ ٱهۡبِطۡ بِسَلَـٰمٖ مِّنَّا وَبَرَكَـٰتٍ عَلَيۡكَ وَعَلَىٰٓ أُمَمٖ مِّمَّن مَّعَكَۚ
verses.transliteration: Qeela yaa Noohuh bit bisalaamim minnaa wa barakaatin 'alaika wa 'alaaa umamim mimmam ma'ak
verses.translation: It was said, 'O Nuh, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you.'

hadiths.text: On the Day of Resurrection, the people will go to Nuh and say, 'O Nuh! You are the first of the Messengers to the people of the earth, and Allah named you a grateful servant.'
hadiths.textArabic: يأتي الناس يوم القيامة إلى نوح فيقولون: يا نوح! أنت أول الرسل إلى أهل الأرض، وقد سماك الله عبداً شكوراً».

sections.contentArabic: وبعد أن انحسرت مياه الطوفان، استقر الفلك على جبل جودي. فأمر الله الأرض أن تبلع ماءها والسماء صفو. ونزل نوح والمؤمنون لتبدأ البشرية من جديد على أرض مطهرة. وبارك الله على نوح ومن معه، ووعدهم أن من نسلهم ستأتي أمم. كان هذا بمثابة بداية جديدة للبشرية، حيث اعتبر نوح الأب الثاني للبشرية بعد آدم.

historicalNotes: Nuh (AS) is one of the five Ulul 'Azm (Prophets of Strong Will) in Islam. His story is mentioned in 43 surahs of the Quran, with Surah Nuh (Chapter 71) dedicated entirely to his account. The exact location of Mount Judi is debated, with some scholars placing it in southeastern Turkey. Archaeological evidence of ancient flood narratives exists across many cultures, supporting the historical reality of a great deluge.
summaryArabic: أُرسل النبي نوح (ع)، المعروف في التوراة بنوح، إلى قومه الذين وقعوا في عبادة الأصنام. ووعظهم 950 سنة يدعوهم إلى عبادة الله وحده. ولما أصروا على رفض رسالته، أمره الله أن يبني فلكًا. أهلك الطوفان الكفار، ونجا نوح والمؤمنون، مما جعله الأب الثاني للبشرية بعد آدم.
historicalNotesArabic: نوح (ع) هو أحد أولياء العزم الخمسة في الإسلام. وردت قصته في 43 سورة من القرآن، وخصصت سورة نوح (الفصل 71) بالكامل لروايته. الموقع الدقيق لجبل جودي محل نقاش، حيث وضعه بعض العلماء في جنوب شرق تركيا. توجد أدلة أثرية على قصص الفيضانات القديمة في العديد من الثقافات، مما يدعم الواقع التاريخي للطوفان العظيم.
keyLessonsArabic: الصبر والمثابرة في الدعوة إلى الله
ثق بوعد الله حتى في مواجهة الاستهزاء
الإيمان يحل محل الروابط العائلية عندما يتعلق الأمر بالحقيقة
ويأتي عذاب الله بعد إنذار طويل
الحمد لله على الخلاص
أهمية اتباع الأوامر الإلهية بدقة

summary: Prophet Hud (AS) was sent to the people of 'Ad, descendants of Nuh who had become one of the mightiest civilizations of their time. They built impressive structures and monuments, boasting of their power and strength. Despite their blessings, they fell into idol worship and oppression. Hud called them to return to Allah, but they rejected him, and Allah destroyed them with a fierce, relentless wind that lasted seven nights and eight days.
keyLessons: Material strength and power cannot protect from Allah's punishment
Gratitude for blessings is essential
Arrogance leads to destruction
True strength lies in faith, not physical might
Allah's punishment comes in various forms

sections.title: The Mighty People of 'Ad
sections.content: The people of 'Ad were descendants of 'Ad ibn Aws ibn Iram ibn Shem ibn Nuh. They settled in Al-Ahqaf, a region of curved sand dunes in southern Arabia. Allah blessed them abundantly - they were physically powerful, tall, and strong. They built magnificent structures, including the legendary city of Iram with its lofty pillars, unmatched in all the lands. They had abundant water, fertile lands, and numerous offspring. But instead of thanking Allah, they became arrogant and began worshipping idols.

verses.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ ۝ إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ ۝ ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ
verses.transliteration: Alam tara kaifa fa'ala Rabbuka bi 'Aad. Irama zaatil 'imaad. Allatee lam yukhlaq misluhaa fil bilaad
verses.translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad - [With] Iram, [who had] lofty pillars, the likes of whom had never been created in the land?

verses.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرۡ أَخَا عَادٍ إِذۡ أَنذَرَ قَوۡمَهُۥ بِٱلۡأَحۡقَافِ
verses.transliteration: Wazkur akhaa 'Aadin iz anzara qawmahoo bil Ahqaaf
verses.translation: And mention [Hud], the brother of 'Aad, when he warned his people in the [region of] sand dunes.

sections.contentArabic: وقوم عاد من ذرية عاد بن أوس بن إرم بن سام بن نوح. واستقروا في الأحقاف، وهي منطقة من الكثبان الرملية المنحنية في جنوب شبه الجزيرة العربية. لقد باركهم الله كثيرًا، فقد كانوا أقوياء جسديًا، وطويلي القامة، وأقوياء. وقاموا ببناء هياكل رائعة، بما في ذلك مدينة إرم الأسطورية بأعمدتها الشامخة التي لا مثيل لها في جميع البلاد. وكان لهم ماء وافر، وأرض خصبة، وذرية كثيرة. ولكن بدلاً من شكر الله استكبروا وعبدوا الأصنام.

sections.title: Hud's Call to His People
sections.content: Allah sent Hud from among them to call them back to the worship of Allah alone. Hud reminded them of Allah's blessings - their strength, their buildings, their prosperity - and urged them to be grateful. He warned them of the fate of the people of Nuh who were destroyed for their disbelief. But the leaders of 'Ad dismissed him as a foolish liar, saying they saw no evidence of his claims and would not abandon the gods of their fathers.

verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ عَادٍ أَخَاهُمۡ هُودٗاۚ قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥٓۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Wa ilaa 'Aadin akhaahum Hoodaa; qaala yaa qawmi'budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo afalaa tattaqoon
verses.translation: And to the 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?'

verses.arabic: أَتَبۡنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ ءَايَةٗ تَعۡبَثُونَ ۝ وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَخۡلُدُونَ
verses.transliteration: Atabnoona bikulli ree'in aayatan ta'basoon. Wa tattakhizoona masaani'a la'allakum takhludoon
verses.translation: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves? And take for yourselves palaces that you might abide eternally?

sections.contentArabic: فبعث الله هودا منهم ليدعوهم إلى عبادة الله وحده. فذكرهم هود بنعم الله عليهم - قوتهم وبنيانهم ورخاءهم - وحثهم على الشكر. وحذرهم من مصير قوم نوح الذين هلكوا بكفرهم. لكن زعماء عاد اعتبروه كاذبًا أحمق، قائلين إنهم لم يروا أي دليل على ادعاءاته ولن يتخلوا عن آلهة آبائهم.

sections.title: Their Arrogant Response
sections.content: The people of 'Ad responded to Hud with arrogance and mockery. They boasted of their strength, asking 'Who is mightier than us in power?' They forgot that Allah who created them was mightier still. They challenged Hud to bring the punishment he warned them about, confident that nothing could harm them. Their arrogance blinded them to the truth, and they continued in their wickedness, oppressing the weak among them.

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ بِغَيۡرِ ٱلۡحَقِّ وَقَالُواْ مَنۡ أَشَدُّ مِنَّا قُوَّةًۖ أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَهُمۡ هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنۡهُمۡ قُوَّةٗ
verses.transliteration: Fa ammaa 'Aadun fastakbaroo fil ardi bighairil haqqi wa qaaloo man ashaddu minnaa quwwah; awalam yaraw annal laahal lazee khalaqahum Huwa ashaddu minhum quwwah
verses.translation: As for 'Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, 'Who is greater than us in strength?' Did they not consider that Allah who created them was greater than them in strength?

verses.arabic: قَالُواْ يَٰهُودُ مَا جِئۡتَنَا بِبَيِّنَةٖ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِتَارِكِيٓ ءَالِهَتِنَا عَن قَوۡلِكَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ لَكَ بِمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa Hoodu maa ji'tanaa bibaiyinatinw wa maa nahnu bitaarikee aalihatinaa 'an qawlika wa maa nahnu laka bimu'mineen
verses.translation: They said, 'O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. And we are not believers in you.'

sections.contentArabic: وقد رد قوم عاد على هود بالاستكبار والاستهزاء. وكانوا يفتخرون بقوتهم ويقولون: من أقوى منا قوة؟ ونسوا أن الله الذي خلقهم هو أقوى. وتحدوا هودًا أن ينزل العقوبة التي حذرهم منها، واثقين أنه لن يضرهم شيء. لقد أعماهم كبرياءهم عن الحق، واستمروا في شرهم، وظلموا الضعفاء فيهم.

sections.title: The Devastating Wind
sections.content: When the people of 'Ad persisted in their disbelief and transgression, Allah sent upon them a furious, barren wind that lasted seven nights and eight days consecutively. The wind was so powerful that it would pick up a person and hurl them to the ground, leaving them like hollow palm trunks. Everything they had built was destroyed. The mighty 'Ad, who boasted of their strength, were left as if they had never existed. Only Hud and those who believed with him were saved.

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ ۝ سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗا فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ
verses.transliteration: Wa ammaa 'Aadun fa uhlikoo bireehsin sarsarin 'aatiyah. Sakhkharahaa 'alaihim sab'a layaalinw wa samaaniyata ayyaamin husooman fataral qawma feehaa sar'aa ka annahum a'jaazu nakhlin khaawiyah
verses.translation: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind which He imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ
verses.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaa 'alaihim reehan sarsaran fee yawmi nahsim mustamirr
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune.

sections.contentArabic: ولما استمر قوم عاد على كفرهم وطغيانهم، بعث الله عليهم ريحا عاصفة عاتية، استمرت سبع ليال وثمانية أيام متتالية. وكانت الريح قوية لدرجة أنها تلتقط الإنسان وتطرحه على الأرض، وتتركه مثل جذوع النخل المجوفة. لقد تم تدمير كل ما بنوه. لقد تُرك عاد الجبار، الذي كان يتباهى بقوته، وكأنهم لم يكونوا موجودين من قبل. ولم ينج إلا هود والذين آمنوا معه.

historicalNotes: The people of 'Ad are considered among the ancient Arabian civilizations. Archaeological discoveries in southern Arabia, including the remains of the ancient city of Ubar (possibly identified as Iram), provide historical context for their existence. Surah Hud (Chapter 11) is named after this prophet, and his story serves as a powerful reminder that no amount of worldly power can protect from Allah's decree.
locationArabic: الأحقاف (جنوب شبه الجزيرة العربية، اليمن/عُمان الحديثة)
summaryArabic: أرسل النبي هود (ع) إلى قوم عاد من نسل نوح الذي أصبح من أعظم الحضارات في عصرهم. لقد بنوا هياكل وآثارًا رائعة، يتباهون بقوتهم وقوتهم. ورغم النعمة التي حظوا بها، فقد وقعوا في عبادة الأوثان والظلم. فدعاهم هود إلى الرجوع إلى الله، فرفضوه، فأهلكهم الله بريح شديدة شديدة استمرت سبع ليال وثمانية أيام.
historicalNotesArabic: ويعتبر قوم عاد من الحضارات العربية القديمة. توفر الاكتشافات الأثرية في جنوب شبه الجزيرة العربية، بما في ذلك بقايا مدينة أوبار القديمة (التي يمكن تحديدها باسم إرم)، سياقًا تاريخيًا لوجودها. تم تسمية سورة هود (الفصل 11) على اسم هذا النبي، وقصته بمثابة تذكير قوي بأنه لا يمكن لأي قدر من القوة الدنيوية أن يحمي من أمر الله.
keyLessonsArabic: القوة المادية والقوة لا يمكن أن تحمي من عقاب الله
إن الشكر على النعم أمر ضروري
فالاستكبار يؤدي إلى الهلاك
القوة الحقيقية تكمن في الإيمان، وليس القوة الجسدية
عقاب الله يأتي بأشكال مختلفة

summary: Prophet Saleh (AS) was sent to the people of Thamud, successors to 'Ad who inherited the earth after them. They carved magnificent homes into the mountains and lived in prosperity. When they demanded a miracle, Allah sent them a miraculous she-camel as a sign. Despite warnings, they hamstrung and killed the camel, bringing upon themselves a devastating earthquake and thunderous blast that destroyed them all.
keyLessons: Divine signs must be respected and heeded
Learning from the fate of previous nations
Corruption of the few can destroy the many
Allah's punishment is swift for those who challenge His signs
Prosperity without gratitude leads to destruction

sections.title: The People of Thamud
sections.content: After the destruction of 'Ad, the people of Thamud rose to prominence. They were descendants of Thamud ibn 'Athir ibn Iram ibn Shem ibn Nuh. Allah blessed them with the ability to carve homes into the mountains with great skill. Their land was fertile, with gardens, springs, and date palms. They lived in security and abundance. But like 'Ad before them, they forgot Allah's blessings and turned to idol worship, following the path of those who were destroyed before them.

verses.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرُوٓاْ إِذۡ جَعَلَكُمۡ خُلَفَآءَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ عَادٖ وَبَوَّأَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِن سُهُولِهَا قُصُورٗا وَتَنۡحِتُونَ ٱلۡجِبَالَ بُيُوتٗاۖ فَٱذۡكُرُوٓاْ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wazkurooo iz ja'alakum khulafaaa'a mim ba'di 'Aadinw wa bawwa akum fil ardi tattakhizoona min suhoolihaa qusooranw wa tanhitoonal jibaala buyootan fazkurooo aalaaa'al laahi wa laa ta'saw fil ardi mufsideen
verses.translation: And remember when He made you successors after 'Aad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allah and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.

verses.arabic: أَتُتۡرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَٰهُنَآ ءَامِنِينَ ۝ فِي جَنَّـٰتٖ وَعُيُونٖ ۝ وَزُرُوعٖ وَنَخۡلٖ طَلۡعُهَا هَضِيمٞ
verses.transliteration: Atutrakona fee maa haahunaa aamineen. Fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon. Wa zuroo'inw wa nakhlin tal'uhaa hadeem
verses.translation: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death] - within gardens and springs, and fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

sections.contentArabic: بعد هلاك عاد، برز قوم ثمود. وهم من ذرية ثمود بن أثير بن إرم بن سام بن نوح. وقد أنعم الله عليهم بالقدرة على نحت البيوت في الجبال بمهارة كبيرة. وكانت أرضهم خصبة، بها حدائق وينابيع ونخيل. وعاشوا في أمن ووفرة. ولكنهم مثل عاد من قبلهم نسوا نعمة الله واتجهوا إلى عبادة الأوثان مقتدين بسبل الذين هلكوا من قبلهم.

sections.title: Saleh's Message
sections.content: Allah sent Saleh, one of their own noble kinsmen, to guide them back to the truth. Saleh reminded them of Allah's blessings and warned them against following the path of 'Ad. He called them to worship Allah alone and to abandon the idols that could neither benefit nor harm them. The wealthy elite among them rejected his message, while some of the weaker members of society believed. The disbelievers accused Saleh of being bewitched and demanded he produce a miracle if he was truly a messenger.

verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمۡ صَـٰلِحٗاۚ قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥ
verses.transliteration: Wa ilaa Samooda akhaahum Saalihaa; qaala yaa qawmi'budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuh
verses.translation: And to Thamud [We sent] their brother Saleh. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him.'

verses.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسَحَّرِينَ ۝ مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaalooo innamaaa anta minal musahhareen. Maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa faati bi aayatin in kunta minas saadiqeen
verses.translation: They said, 'You are only of those affected by magic. You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful.'

sections.contentArabic: فبعث الله صالحا من أقربائهم الكرام ليهديهم إلى الحق. فذكرهم صالح بنعم الله وحذرهم من اتباع طريق عاد. ودعاهم إلى عبادة الله وحده، وترك الأصنام التي لا تنفعهم ولا تضرهم. رفضت النخبة منهم رسالته، بينما صدقها بعض الضعفاء في المجتمع. واتهم الكفار صالح بالسحر وطالبوه بأن يأتي بمعجزة إن كان حقا رسولا.

sections.title: The Miraculous She-Camel
sections.content: In response to their demand, Allah brought forth a miraculous she-camel from a solid rock. This was no ordinary camel - it was enormous, and it would drink all the water of their well on one day, while providing them abundant milk in return. Saleh warned them that the camel was a sign from Allah and must not be harmed. He established that the water would be shared - one day for the camel, one day for them. For a time, they honored this arrangement.

verses.arabic: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ ۝ وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
verses.transliteration: Qaala haazihee naaqatul lahaa shirbunw wa lakum shirbu yawmim ma'loom. Wa laa tamassoohaa bisooo'in fa yaakhuzakum 'azaabu yawmin 'azeem
verses.translation: He said, 'This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day. And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day.'

verses.arabic: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ
verses.transliteration: Innaa mursilun naaqati fitnatal lahum fartaqibhum wastabir
verses.translation: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.

sections.contentArabic: واستجابة لطلبهم، أخرج الله ناقة معجزة من صخرة صلبة. لم يكن هذا الجمل عاديًا، بل كان ضخمًا، وكان يشرب كل مياه بئرهم في يوم واحد، بينما يوفر لهم في المقابل الكثير من الحليب. وحذرهم صالح من أن الجمل آية من الله ولا يجوز إيذاءها. وأقر أن الماء قسمة: يوم للجمل، ويوم لهم. لبعض الوقت، احترموا هذا الترتيب.

sections.title: The Crime of Killing the Camel
sections.content: The leaders of Thamud grew resentful of the camel and plotted to kill it. They encouraged a wretched man among them named Qidar ibn Salif to hamstring the camel. He did so, and the camel was killed. When Saleh saw this, he warned them that they had only three days before Allah's punishment would come. They mocked him, challenging him to bring the punishment. Those three days passed with signs of impending doom - their faces changed color each day.

verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
verses.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa'aqaroohaa fadamdama 'alaihim Rabbuhum bizambihim fasawwaahaa
verses.translation: But they denied him and hamstrung her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].

verses.arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَقَالَ تَمَتَّعُواْ فِي دَارِكُمۡ ثَلَـٰثَةَ أَيَّامٖۖ ذَٰلِكَ وَعۡدٌ غَيۡرُ مَكۡذُوبٖ
verses.transliteration: Fa'aqaroohaa faqaala tamatta'oo fee daarikum salaasata ayyaam; zaalika wa'dun ghairu makzoob
verses.translation: But they hamstrung her, so he said, 'Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied.'

sections.contentArabic: استاء زعماء ثمود من الجمل وتآمروا على قتله. وشجعوا رجلا منهم شقيا اسمه قيدار بن صليف على عقر البعير. ففعل ذلك فقُتل الجمل. فلما رأى صالح ذلك حذرهم من أن أمامهم ثلاثة أيام فقط قبل أن يأتي عذاب الله. فسخروا منه وتحدوه أن ينزل العقوبة. مرت تلك الأيام الثلاثة مع ظهور علامات الهلاك الوشيك، حيث تغير لون وجوههم كل يوم.

sections.title: The Destruction of Thamud
sections.content: On the fourth day, a mighty blast from the heavens struck the people of Thamud, accompanied by a devastating earthquake. The same people who had carved homes into the mountains, thinking themselves secure, were destroyed in their own dwellings. They lay fallen in their homes as if they had never lived there. Only Saleh and those who believed with him were saved. The ruins of their civilization remain as a warning to those who pass by.

verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلرَّجۡفَةُ فَأَصۡبَحُواْ فِي دَارِهِمۡ جَٰثِمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Fa akhazat humur rajfatu fa asbahoo fee daarihim jaasimeen
verses.translation: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ
verses.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaa 'alaihim saihatanw waahidatan fakaanoo kahasheemil muhtazir
verses.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.

hadiths.text: When the Prophet (ﷺ) passed by Al-Hijr [the land of Thamud], he said: 'Do not enter the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, unless you are weeping, lest what befell them should befall you.'
hadiths.textArabic: ولما مر النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم بالحجر قال: (لا تدخلوا مساكن الذين ظلموا أنفسهم إلا أن تكونوا باكين أن يصيبكم ما أصابهم).

sections.contentArabic: وفي اليوم الرابع، أصابت قوم ثمود ريح عظيمة من السماء، صاحبها زلزلة مدمرة. نفس الأشخاص الذين بنوا بيوتهم في الجبال، معتقدين أنهم آمنون، تم تدميرهم في مساكنهم. لقد سقطوا في منازلهم وكأنهم لم يعيشوا فيها أبدًا. ولم ينج إلا صالح والذين آمنوا معه. وتبقى آثار حضارتهم عبرة لمن يمرون بها.

historicalNotes: The ruins of Madain Saleh (Al-Hijr) in northwestern Saudi Arabia are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and are believed to be the dwellings of Thamud. The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) passed by this area during the expedition to Tabuk and warned his companions about entering these ruins. The carved rock tombs and structures visible today serve as a powerful reminder of this Quranic narrative.
summaryArabic: وبعث النبي صالح (ع) إلى قوم ثمود خلفاء عاد الذين ورثوا الأرض من بعدهم. لقد نحتوا منازل رائعة في الجبال وعاشوا في رخاء. وعندما طلبوا معجزة، أرسل الله لهم ناقة معجزة كعلامة. وعلى الرغم من التحذيرات، فقد عرققوا الجمل وقتلوه، مما جلب على أنفسهم زلزالًا مدمرًا وانفجارًا مدويًا دمرهم جميعًا.
historicalNotesArabic: تعد آثار مدائن صالح (الحجر) في شمال غرب المملكة العربية السعودية أحد مواقع التراث العالمي لليونسكو ويعتقد أنها مساكن ثمود. وقد مر النبي محمد (صلى الله عليه وسلم) بهذه المنطقة في غزوة تبوك وحذر أصحابه من دخول هذه الآثار. إن المقابر والهياكل الصخرية المنحوتة المرئية اليوم بمثابة تذكير قوي بهذه الرواية القرآنية.
keyLessonsArabic: ويجب احترام العلامات الإلهية والإصغاء إليها
التعلم من مصير الأمم السابقة
فساد القلة يمكن أن يدمر الكثيرين
إن عذاب الله سريع لمن تحدى بآياته
الرخاء بدون شكر يؤدي إلى الهلاك

summary: Prophet Ibrahim (AS), known as Khalilullah (Friend of Allah) and the Father of the Prophets, is one of the greatest prophets in Islamic history. He demonstrated unwavering faith through numerous trials: challenging idol worship, being thrown into fire, leaving his family in the barren valley of Makkah, and being commanded to sacrifice his son. He rebuilt the Ka'bah with his son Ismail and is the patriarch of both Arab and Israelite prophetic lineages.
keyLessons: Pure monotheism (Tawheed) above all else
Complete submission to Allah's will (Islam)
Trust in Allah even in impossible situations
Sacrifice for the sake of Allah
Hospitality and generosity to guests
Breaking away from ancestral misguidance
Family unity in worship and obedience

sections.title: Search for the Truth
sections.content: Ibrahim was born in a time and place where idol worship was prevalent. His father Azar was an idol maker for the king Nimrod. From a young age, Ibrahim's pure nature (fitrah) led him to question the worship of idols that could neither hear nor see. He observed his people worshipping celestial bodies as well. When he saw a star, then the moon, then the sun, each setting and disappearing, he reasoned that none of these could be the true Lord. He turned his face to the One who created all things - the Lord of the heavens and the earth.

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَنَّ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلَّيۡلُ رَءَا كَوۡكَبٗاۖ قَالَ هَٰذَا رَبِّيۖ فَلَمَّآ أَفَلَ قَالَ لَآ أُحِبُّ ٱلۡأٓفِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammaa janna 'alaihil lailu ra aa kawkaban qaala haazaa Rabbee falammaa afala qaala laaa uhibbul aafileen
verses.translation: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, 'This is my lord.' But when it set, he said, 'I like not those that set.'

verses.arabic: إِنِّي وَجَّهۡتُ وَجۡهِيَ لِلَّذِي فَطَرَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ حَنِيفٗا وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ
verses.transliteration: Innee wajjahtu wajhiya lillazee fataras samaawaati wal arda haneefanw wa maaa ana minal mushrikeen
verses.translation: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah.

sections.contentArabic: ولد إبراهيم في زمان ومكان كانت عبادة الأوثان منتشرة فيه. وكان أبوه آزار صانع أصنام للملك نمرود. منذ صغره، دفعته فطرته النقية إلى التشكيك في عبادة الأصنام التي لا تسمع ولا تبصر. ولاحظ أن شعبه يعبدون الأجرام السماوية أيضًا. وعندما رأى النجم، ثم القمر، ثم الشمس، كل غروب ثم يختفي، اعتقد أن لا أحد من هؤلاء يمكن أن يكون الرب الحقيقي. ووجه وجهه إلى الذي خلق كل شيء، رب السماوات والأرض.

sections.title: Confronting His Father
sections.content: Ibrahim approached his father Azar with gentleness, calling him to abandon idol worship. He asked why his father worshipped that which could not hear, see, or benefit him in any way. He warned his father that knowledge had come to him from Allah and urged him to follow him to the straight path. But Azar rejected his son's call, threatening to stone him and ordering him to leave. Ibrahim parted from him with words of peace, promising to seek forgiveness for him from his Lord.

verses.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لِمَ تَعۡبُدُ مَا لَا يَسۡمَعُ وَلَا يُبۡصِرُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي عَنكَ شَيۡـٔٗا
verses.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi yaaa abati lima ta'budu maa laa yasma'u wa laa yubsiru wa laa yughnee 'anka shai'aa
verses.translation: When he said to his father, 'O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?'

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنۡ ءَالِهَتِي يَـٰٓإِبۡرَٰهِيمُۖ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ لَأَرۡجُمَنَّكَۖ وَٱهۡجُرۡنِي مَلِيّٗا
verses.transliteration: Qaala a raaghbun anta 'an aalihatee yaaa Ibraaheem; la'il lam tantahi la arjumannaka wahjurnee maliyyaa
verses.translation: He said, 'Have you no desire for my gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time.'

sections.contentArabic: اقترب إبراهيم من أبيه آزر بلطف، ودعاه إلى ترك عبادة الأوثان. وسأل لماذا كان والده يعبد ما لا يسمع ولا يرى ولا ينفعه شيئا؟ وحذر والده من أن العلم قد جاءه من عند الله، وحثه على اتباعه إلى الصراط المستقيم. لكن عازار رفض دعوة ابنه وهدده برجمه وأمره بالرحيل. ففارقه إبراهيم بالسلام، ووعده بالاستغفار له من ربه.

sections.title: Destroying the Idols
sections.content: When his people left for a festival, Ibrahim stayed behind and went to their temple. He took an axe and destroyed all the idols except the largest one, upon whose neck he hung the axe. When the people returned and saw their gods smashed, they suspected Ibrahim. He challenged them to ask the chief idol who had done this, exposing the foolishness of worshipping objects that could neither speak nor defend themselves. Though they recognized the truth, their pride prevented them from accepting it.

verses.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ جُذَٰذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرٗا لَّهُمۡ لَعَلَّهُمۡ إِلَيۡهِ يَرۡجِعُونَ
verses.transliteration: Faja'alahum juzaazan illaa kabeeran lahum la'allahum ilaihi yarji'oon
verses.translation: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

verses.arabic: قَالَ بَلۡ فَعَلَهُۥ كَبِيرُهُمۡ هَٰذَا فَسۡـَٔلُوهُمۡ إِن كَانُواْ يَنطِقُونَ
verses.transliteration: Qaala bal fa'alahoo kabeeruhum haazaa fas'aloohum in kaanoo yantiqoon
verses.translation: He said, 'Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak.'

sections.contentArabic: ولما خرج قومه إلى عيد، تخلف إبراهيم عنهم، فذهب إلى معبدهم. فأخذ الفأس وحطم جميع الأصنام إلا أكبرها الذي علق الفأس على عنقه. وعندما عاد الناس ورأوا آلهتهم قد تحطمت، اشتبهوا في إبراهيم. وتحداهم أن يسألوا كبير الأصنام من فعل هذا، كاشفًا حماقة عبادة الأشياء التي لا تستطيع أن تتكلم أو تدافع عن نفسها. ومع أنهم عرفوا الحق، فإن كبريائهم منعهم من قبوله.

sections.title: Trial by Fire
sections.content: The people, led by King Nimrod, decided to punish Ibrahim by throwing him into a massive fire. They built a huge pyre, so large that they had to use a catapult to throw him in because no one could approach it. As Ibrahim was hurled toward the flames, Jibreel came to him offering help, but Ibrahim replied that Allah was sufficient for him. At that moment, Allah commanded the fire to be cool and peaceful upon Ibrahim. He emerged unharmed, and this miracle convinced some onlookers of his truth.

verses.arabic: قَالُواْ حَرِّقُوهُ وَٱنصُرُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ فَٰعِلِينَ
verses.transliteration: Qaaloo harriqoohu wansurooo aalihatakum in kuntum faa'ileen
verses.translation: They said, 'Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act.'

verses.arabic: قُلۡنَا يَٰنَارُ كُونِي بَرۡدٗا وَسَلَٰمًا عَلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ
verses.transliteration: Qulnaa yaa naaru koonee bardanw wa salaaman 'alaaa Ibraaheem
verses.translation: We said, 'O fire, be coolness and safety upon Ibrahim.'

hadiths.text: When Ibrahim was thrown into the fire, he said: 'Hasbunallah wa ni'mal wakeel (Allah is sufficient for us and He is the Best Disposer of affairs).' And the same was said by Muhammad (ﷺ) when it was said to him: 'The people have gathered against you.'
hadiths.textArabic: ولما ألقي إبراهيم في النار قال: حسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل. وكذا قال محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم حين قيل له: إن الناس قد جمعوا عليك.

sections.contentArabic: فقرر الشعب بقيادة الملك نمرود معاقبة إبراهيم بإلقائه في نار هائلة. لقد بنوا محرقة ضخمة، كبيرة جدًا لدرجة أنهم اضطروا إلى استخدام المنجنيق لإلقائه فيها لأنه لم يتمكن أحد من الاقتراب منها. وبينما كان إبراهيم يُلقى في النار، جاءه جبريل يعرض عليه المساعدة، فأجاب إبراهيم: حسبه الله. وفي تلك اللحظة أمر الله النار أن تكون بردا وسلاما على إبراهيم. وخرج سالمًا، وأقنعت هذه المعجزة بعض الناظرين بحقيقته.

sections.title: Migration and Family
sections.content: After his trial by fire, Ibrahim migrated with his wife Sarah and his nephew Lut to the blessed land of Sham (Greater Syria). Allah blessed Ibrahim with two sons in his old age - Ismail from Hajar and Ishaq from Sarah. When commanded by Allah, Ibrahim took Hajar and baby Ismail to the barren valley of Makkah and left them there with only dates and water, trusting in Allah's plan. When the water ran out, Hajar ran between Safa and Marwa searching for help, until the spring of Zamzam miraculously gushed forth.

verses.arabic: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ٱلَّتِي بَٰرَكۡنَا فِيهَا لِلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa najjainaahu wa Lootan ilal ardil latee baaraknaa feehaa lil'aalameen
verses.translation: And We delivered him and Lut to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.

verses.arabic: رَّبَّنَآ إِنِّيٓ أَسۡكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِي بِوَادٍ غَيۡرِ ذِي زَرۡعٍ عِندَ بَيۡتِكَ ٱلۡمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ فَٱجۡعَلۡ أَفۡـِٔدَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ تَهۡوِيٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ
verses.transliteration: Rabbanaaa innee askantu min zurriyyatee biwaadin ghairi zee zar'in 'inda Baitikal Muharrami Rabbanaa liyuqeemus Salaata faj'al af'idatam minan naasi tahweee ilaihim
verses.translation: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them.

hadiths.text: Ibrahim brought Hajar and her son Ismail while she was suckling him, to a place near the Ka'bah under a tree above Zamzam. There was nobody in Makkah at that time, and there was no water either.
hadiths.textArabic: وأتى إبراهيم بهاجر وابنها إسماعيل وهي ترضعه إلى مكان قريب من الكعبة تحت شجرة فوق زمزم. ولم يكن بمكة يومئذ أحد، ولم يكن فيها ماء أيضًا.

sections.contentArabic: وبعد ابتلاءه بالنار، هاجر إبراهيم مع زوجته سارة وابن أخيه لوط إلى أرض الشام المباركة. ورزق الله إبراهيم ولدين في شيخوخته - إسماعيل من حجر وإسحاق من سارة. عندما أمر الله إبراهيم، أخذ هاجر والطفل إسماعيل إلى وادي مكة القاحل ولم يترك لهما هناك سوى التمر والماء، واثقًا بتدبير الله. وعندما نضب الماء، ركضت هاجر بين الصفا والمروة تطلب النجدة، حتى تدفقت عين زمزم بأعجوبة.

sections.title: The Ultimate Sacrifice
sections.content: When Ismail was old enough to walk with his father, Ibrahim saw in a dream that he was sacrificing his son. Prophetic dreams are revelation from Allah. Ibrahim told Ismail about the dream, and the obedient son replied, 'Do as you are commanded, father. You will find me, if Allah wills, among the patient.' As Ibrahim laid his son down and put the knife to his neck, Allah called out to him that he had fulfilled the vision. A great ram was sent down as a ransom, and this event established the practice of sacrifice during Eid al-Adha.

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
verses.transliteration: Falammaa balagha ma'ahus sa'ya qaala yaa bunayya innee araa fil manaami annee azbahuka fanzur maazaa taraa; qaala yaaa abatif 'al maa tu'mar; satajidunee in shaaa'al laahu minas saabireen
verses.translation: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, 'O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think.' He said, 'O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the patient.'

verses.arabic: وَفَدَيۡنَٰهُ بِذِبۡحٍ عَظِيمٖ
verses.transliteration: Wa fadainaahu bizibhin 'azeem
verses.translation: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.

sections.contentArabic: ولما بلغ إسماعيل من العمر ما يكفي ليمشي مع أبيه، رأى إبراهيم في المنام أنه يذبح ابنه. الأحلام النبوية هي الوحي من الله. وأخبر إبراهيم إسماعيل بالحلم، فأجاب الابن المطيع: افعل كما أمرت يا أبت. ستجدني إن شاء الله من الصابرين. فلما وضع إبراهيم ابنه ووضع السكين في عنقه، ناداه الله بأن قد حققت الرؤيا. تم إرسال كبش عظيم فدية، وهذا الحدث أسس لممارسة التضحية خلال عيد الأضحى.

sections.title: Building the Ka'bah
sections.content: Allah commanded Ibrahim and Ismail to raise the foundations of the Ka'bah, the first House of worship established for mankind. Father and son worked together, with Ismail bringing stones and Ibrahim laying them. As they built, they prayed for Allah to accept their work and to make them and their descendants a nation submitted to Him (Muslims). They prayed for a messenger to be raised from among their descendants - a prayer answered centuries later with Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). The stone Ibrahim stood on, Maqam Ibrahim, remains beside the Ka'bah to this day.

verses.arabic: وَإِذۡ يَرۡفَعُ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمُ ٱلۡقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ ٱلۡبَيۡتِ وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلُ رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلۡ مِنَّآۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
verses.transliteration: Wa iz yarfa'u Ibraaheemul qawaa'ida minal Bayti wa Ismaa'eelu Rabbanaa taqabbal minnaa innaka Antas Samee'ul 'Aleem
verses.translation: And [mention] when Ibrahim was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ismail, [saying], 'Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.'

verses.arabic: إِنَّ أَوَّلَ بَيۡتٖ وُضِعَ لِلنَّاسِ لَلَّذِي بِبَكَّةَ مُبَارَكٗا وَهُدٗى لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Inna awwala Baitin wudi'a linnaasi lallazee bi Bakkata mubaarakanw wa hudal lil'aalameen
verses.translation: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah - blessed and a guidance for the worlds.

hadiths.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The first food to be eaten by the people of Paradise will be the caudate lobe of fish-liver. As for the resemblance of the children to their parents: If a man approaches his wife and his discharge precedes hers, the child will resemble him; if her discharge precedes his, the child will resemble her.' Ibrahim said, 'I bear witness that you are the Messenger of Allah.'
hadiths.textArabic: قال النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم: «أول طعام يأكله أهل الجنة زيادة كبد الحوت». وأما تشبيه الأبناء بوالديهم: فإن الرجل إذا اقترب من امرأته وسبق ماءه سيله يشبهه الولد؛ فإذا سبق سيلانها كان الولد يشبهها. فقال إبراهيم: أشهد أنك رسول الله.

sections.contentArabic: أمر الله إبراهيم وإسماعيل أن يقيما أساسات الكعبة، أول بيت وضع للناس. عمل الأب والابن معًا، حيث أحضر إسماعيل الحجارة وقام إبراهيم بوضعها. وأثناء بنائهم دعوا الله أن يتقبل عملهم، وأن يجعلهم وذريتهم أمة مسلمة. لقد دعوا أن يبعث من بين ذريتهم رسول - وهي صلاة استجابت بعد قرون مع النبي محمد (صلى الله عليه وسلم). الحجر الذي وقف عليه إبراهيم، مقام إبراهيم، لا يزال قائما بجانب الكعبة حتى يومنا هذا.

historicalNotes: Ibrahim (AS) is one of the five Ulul 'Azm (Prophets of Strong Will) and is mentioned in 25 surahs of the Quran. He is the patriarch of the three Abrahamic faiths. Surah Ibrahim (Chapter 14) is named after him. The rituals of Hajj commemorate events from his life, including the Tawaf, Sa'i between Safa and Marwa (commemorating Hajar's search for water), and the sacrifice. His legacy of pure monotheism (Hanifiyyah) is the foundation upon which Islam is built.
locationArabic: أور (العراق)، حران، كنعان (فلسطين)، مصر، مكة المكرمة
summaryArabic: يعد النبي إبراهيم (ع)، المعروف بخليل الله وأبي الأنبياء، أحد أعظم الأنبياء في التاريخ الإسلامي. لقد أظهر إيمانًا راسخًا من خلال تجارب عديدة: تحدي عبادة الأوثان، وإلقائه في النار، وترك عائلته في وادي مكة القاحل، وأمر بالتضحية بابنه. أعاد بناء الكعبة مع ابنه إسماعيل وهو بطريرك الأنساب النبوية العربية والإسرائيلية.
historicalNotesArabic: وإبراهيم (ع) هو أحد أولي العزم الخمسة، وقد ورد ذكره في 25 سورة من القرآن. وهو بطريرك الديانات الإبراهيمية الثلاثة. سورة إبراهيم (الفصل 14) سميت باسمه. طقوس الحج تخلد ذكرى أحداث من حياته، بما في ذلك الطواف والسعي بين الصفا والمروة (ذكرى بحث هاجر عن الماء) والأضحية. إن تراثه من التوحيد الخالص (الحنفية) هو الأساس الذي بني عليه الإسلام.
keyLessonsArabic: التوحيد الخالص قبل كل شيء
التسليم الكامل لإرادة الله (الإسلام)
توكل على الله حتى في المواقف المستحيلة
التضحية في سبيل الله
حسن الضيافة والكرم للضيوف
الابتعاد عن ضلال الأجداد
وحدة الأسرة في العبادة والطاعة

summary: Prophet Lut (AS), nephew of Ibrahim (AS), was sent to the people of Sodom and neighboring cities who committed unprecedented sins. Despite his tireless warnings about their immoral practices, the people rejected him and continued their transgression. Allah destroyed the cities with a catastrophic punishment, saving only Lut and his believing followers.
keyLessons: The severity of sexual immorality and its consequences
A prophet's duty to warn even the most corrupt societies
Allah's protection of the righteous amidst destruction
The importance of following divine guidance over societal norms
Family ties do not exempt disbelievers from punishment

sections.title: The Mission to Sodom
sections.content: Lut (AS) accompanied his uncle Ibrahim (AS) on the journey from Mesopotamia and eventually settled in the region of Sodom near the Dead Sea. Allah appointed him as a prophet to the people of these cities who had introduced sins unprecedented in human history. Despite being among them, Lut was a stranger to their ways, a righteous man commanding good and forbidding evil. The Quran describes him as being given wisdom and knowledge, and he was counted among the righteous.

verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ حُكۡمٗا وَعِلۡمٗا وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلۡقَرۡيَةِ ٱلَّتِي كَانَت تَّعۡمَلُ ٱلۡخَبَٰٓئِثَۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمَ سَوۡءٖ فَٰسِقِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Lootan aatainaahu hukmanw wa 'ilmanw wa najjainaahu minal qaryatil latee kaanat ta'malul khabaaith; innahum kaanoo qawma saw'in faasiqeen
verses.translation: And to Lut We gave judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

sections.contentArabic: رافق لوط (ع) عمه إبراهيم (ع) في الرحلة من بلاد ما بين النهرين واستقر في نهاية المطاف في منطقة سدوم بالقرب من البحر الميت. وقد بعثه الله نبيا إلى أهل هذه القرى الذين أدخلوا الذنوب التي لم يسبق لها مثيل في تاريخ البشرية. ولوط على الرغم من كونه بينهم، إلا أنه كان غريبا عن طرقهم، رجلا صالحا يأمر بالمعروف وينهى عن المنكر. وقد وصفه القرآن بأنه أوتي الحكمة والعلم، وكان من الصالحين.

sections.title: Warning Against Transgression
sections.content: Lut (AS) called his people to abandon their unprecedented sins and return to the natural way ordained by Allah. He reminded them of Allah's countless blessings and warned them of the consequences of their transgression. He appealed to their reason, pointing out that their actions went against the very nature Allah created. But they mocked him and threatened to expel him from their city if he did not cease his warnings.

verses.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذۡ قَالَ لِقَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلۡفَٰحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنۡ أَحَدٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Wa Lootan iz qaala liqawmiheee ataatoonal faahishata maa sabaqakum bihaa min ahadim minal 'aalameen
verses.translation: And [mention] Lut, when he said to his people, 'Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?'

verses.arabic: أَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلذُّكۡرَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.transliteration: Ata'toonaz zukraana minal 'aalameen
verses.translation: Do you approach males among the worlds?

sections.contentArabic: وقد دعا لوط (ع) قومه إلى ترك ذنوبهم غير المسبوقة والعودة إلى الطريق الطبيعي الذي أمر به الله. وذكرهم بنعم الله التي لا تعد ولا تحصى، وحذرهم من عواقب تجاوزهم. ولجأ إلى عقلهم، مشيراً إلى أن أفعالهم تتعارض مع طبيعة الله التي خلقها. لكنهم سخروا منه وهددوه بطرده من مدينتهم إذا لم يكف عن تحذيراته.

sections.title: The Arrival of the Angels
sections.content: Allah sent angels in the form of handsome young men to Lut's city. Ibrahim had hosted these angels first, and when they departed toward Sodom, he felt great distress knowing what awaited the city. Lut, unaware of their true nature, was deeply troubled when they arrived, knowing his people's behavior. The men of the city soon surrounded his house, demanding access to his guests. Lut desperately tried to reason with them, offering an alternative and begging them to fear Allah, but they refused.

verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَتۡ رُسُلُنَا لُوطٗا سِيٓءَ بِهِمۡ وَضَاقَ بِهِمۡ ذَرۡعٗا وَقَالَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَصِيبٞ
verses.transliteration: Wa lammaa jaaa'at Rusulunaa Lootan seee'a bihim wa daaqa bihim zar'anw wa qaala haazaa Yawmun 'aseeb
verses.translation: And when Our messengers came to Lut, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, 'This is a trying day.'

verses.arabic: وَجَآءَهُۥ قَوۡمُهُۥ يُهۡرَعُونَ إِلَيۡهِ وَمِن قَبۡلُ كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِۚ
verses.transliteration: Wa jaaa'ahoo qawmuhoo yuhra'oona ilaihi wa min qablu kaanoo ya'maloonas saiyiaat
verses.translation: And his people came rushing towards him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds.

sections.contentArabic: أرسل الله ملائكة على هيئة شباب جميلين إلى مدينة لوط. كان إبراهيم قد استضاف هؤلاء الملائكة أولاً، وعندما غادروا نحو سدوم، شعر بضيق شديد عندما علم بما ينتظر المدينة. لوط، غير مدرك لطبيعتهم الحقيقية، انزعج بشدة عندما وصلوا، لعلمه بسلوك قومه. وسرعان ما حاصر رجال المدينة منزله مطالبين بالوصول إلى ضيوفه. وحاول لوط يائسًا أن يجادلهم ويعرض عليهم البديل ويرجوهم أن يتقوا الله، لكنهم رفضوا.

sections.title: The Destruction of Sodom
sections.content: The angels revealed their true identity to Lut, assuring him that the people could not harm him or his guests.
